definition: to be estranged
to appear/to look/form/shape
like/same/similar/together/alike/with
(used in given names)/variant of 同[tong2]
see 衚衕|胡同[hu2 tong4]
raised path/street
surname Lu
road/CL:條|条[tiao2]/journey/route/line (bus etc)/sort/kind

sentences.english: We whether only visible with stranger, only then cannot be tired?
sentences.chinese: 我们能否只要形同陌路，才不会累？

sentences.english: I know, But why many years later you change so much like a stranger?
sentences.chinese: 这点我了解，但是为什么多年以后你要形同陌路？

sentences.english: You I shape with stranger, meet also owes a game.
sentences.chinese: 你我形同陌路，相遇也是恩泽一场。

sentences.english: You and I strangers meet is a grace.
sentences.chinese: 你我形同陌路，相遇也是恩泽一场。

sentences.english: PeiWenDi suddenly appeared, but with own daughter jade beads become strangers.
sentences.chinese: 裴文棣突然出现，但却与亲生女儿玉珠形同陌路。

sentences.english: Neighbors don't have to be friends, but they need not be strangers either.
sentences.chinese: 邻居不一定成为朋友，但他们也不可彼此形同陌路。

sentences.english: Why did you give me the go -by in the street yesterday?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么昨天在街上对我视而不见，形同陌路？

sentences.english: We were under the same roof but not together.
sentences.chinese: 我俩虽然同在一个屋檐下，但是形同陌路。

sentences.english: Love-is meets from morning until evening, actually shape with stranger.
sentences.chinese: 爱情是朝夕相见却形同陌路。

sentences.english: So villagers do each other favours while residents of large, anonymous cities do not.
sentences.chinese: 比如，村里人相互关照，而大城市里的人们形同陌路。

definition: stranger
(literary) stranger
(of relatives or friends) to live far apart from each other
the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
close relation, no gap (idiom); intimate and nothing can come between
to split up/to break all ties
to become enemies (idiom); to fall out with sb
lit. to take different roads and urge the horses on (idiom)/fig. to part ways
not to hold anything back (idiom)/(of close friends etc) to tell each other everything
to go separate ways (idiom)/to part ways with sb/Taiwan pr. [ge4 ben1 dong1 xi1]
to part without hard feelings (idiom)/to cut the knot as smoothly as you tied it
stuck together as by glue (of lovers)/joined at the hip
to quarrel/to fall out with sb
destined to meet but not fated to be together (idiom)
nodding acquaintance
to love each other
